meanings.definition: Relating to external stimuli or sensations.
meanings.sent1: The exteroceptive senses help us understand the world around us.
meanings.sent2: She had a keen exteroceptive awareness of her surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The exteroceptive alarm clock woke him up with its loud ringing.
meanings.sent4: Her exteroceptive intuition told her a storm was coming.
meanings.sent5: The exteroceptive experience of feeling the warm sun on her skin was delightful.

meanings.definition: Perceiving or responding to stimuli from outside the body.
meanings.sent1: Dogs have highly exteroceptive abilities, detecting scents from far away.
meanings.sent2: The exteroceptive nature of his job required constant vigilance.
meanings.sent3: The exteroceptive cat chased after the moving laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: His exteroceptive reflexes kicked in when he heard a sudden noise.
meanings.sent5: The exteroceptive response to the bright light made her squint.
